objectives: Students will discuss food and dining out using Formal/Business register language
Students will engage with Comedy themed scenarios related to food and dining out
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of formal level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining food and dining out content with Comedy narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore food and dining out through a Comedy lens using Formal/Business language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a humorous misunderstanding or funny situation involving food and dining out

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice formal register vocabulary related to food and dining out in a comedy context
Students engage in comedy themed role-play about food and dining out using formal register
Students create original comedy themed content about food and dining out in formal register

discussion_questions: How would you describe food and dining out in a Comedy scenario?
What hilarious or amusing might be involved in food and dining out?
Can you create a Comedy story about food and dining out?
How does food and dining out change when viewed through a Comedy perspective?
What formal register expressions would you use to discuss this comedy scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Comedy situation involving food and dining out
roles: Character A: Using formal register in comedy context
Character B: Responding in formal register within comedy theme

topic_genre_blend: food and dining out with hilarious
food and dining out with amusing
food and dining out with ridiculous

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Formal/Business throughout: Professional, business-appropriate language
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Comedy theme: Humor, wit, funny situations

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Formal/Business register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Comedy themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of formal register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
